question: A duck was given $9, a spider was given $36, a bee was given $27. Based off of this information, how much money would be given to a cat?
A grandmother, two mothers, and two daughters went to a baseball game together and bought one ticket each. How many tickets did they buy in total?
There are 2 ducks in front of 2 other ducks. There are 2 ducks behind 2 other ducks. There are 2 ducks beside 2 other ducks. How many ducks are there?
If two's company and three's a crowd, what are four and five?
If there are 4 apples and you take away 3, how many do you have?
Mary has 7 daughters and each of them has a brother. Can you figure out the total number of kids Mary have?
I am between 0 and 15. I am less than 10. I am the number of days in one week. What number am I?
In two years I know, I'll be twice as old as five years ago, said Tom. How old is Tom?
Four years ago, Alex was twice as old as Jake. Four years from now, Jake will be 3/4 of Alex's age. How old is Alex?
There are 12 kids in a classroom. 6 kids are wearing socks and 4 are wearing shoes. 3 kids are wearing both. How many are bare feet?
I am between 0 and 20. I am more than the number of fingers on two hands. I am one less than 15.What number am I?
I am less than 15.  I am more than 6 plus 3. I am one less than thirteen. What number am I?
I am between 0 and 15. I am more than 4. I am one less than 11. What number am I?
Carson bumps into his toy box, 4 toys spill onto the floor, but 5 toys stay in the box. How many toys did Carson have in the toy box?
Mr. Grey helped dry the dishes. He dried 3 small glasses and 5 large glasses. How many plasses did he dry?
